medical_history.chief_complaint: Daily fevers and cutaneous ulcers on distal extremities.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 12 years ago with daily temperatures between 38.4°C to 38.9°C. Fevers resolved after one year but returned three years later, reaching up to 40.0°C. Hospitalized multiple times and treated with corticosteroids. Developed purple toes, digital tissue loss, and foot ulcers over time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previously diagnosed with Still disease, treated with indomethacin, and continued on prednisone for 8 years resulting in posterior subcapsular cataracts, osteoporosis, and mild glucose intolerance.
medical_history.social_history: Works as a school librarian, married for 3 years with unsuccessful attempts to conceive for 12 months, does not smoke or drink.
